instruction: Create an Annotated Bibliography, in APA citation style, with six entries describing a different social media technology in each of the following six categories: blogs, social networking sites, virtual social worlds, virtual game worlds, collaborative projects, content communities.
output:
1. Blogs:
   a. Kozlowski, S. W., & Smith, K. (2011). The impact of blogs on organizational knowledge management. In Proceedings of the 44th Annual Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences, 1-10.
This study examines the role of blogs in enhancing organizational knowledge management by facilitating communication, information sharing, and collaboration among employees.

2. Social Networking Sites:
   a. Ellison, N. B., & Boyd, D. (2008). Social network sites: Definition, history, and scholarship. Journal of Computer-Mediated Communication, 13(1), 210-230.
This paper provides a comprehensive definition, history, and analysis of social networking sites, such as Facebook and LinkedIn, focusing on their impact on interpersonal relationships and communication.

3. Virtual Social Worlds:
   a. Taddicken, M. C., & Sommer, R. E. (2012). The role of virtual worlds in the socialization of teenagers. In Proceedings of the 45th Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences, 1-10.
This research explores the role of virtual social worlds, such as Second Life, in the socialization process of teenagers, including the development of social skills, identity formation, and online etiquette.

4. Virtual Game Worlds:
   a. Hamari, J., Shernoff, D. J., Rowe, E., Coller, B., Asbell-Clarke, J., & Edwards, T. (2011). Challenging games help classrooms engage: A study on the effectiveness of using multiplayer online games to enhance teaching. Computers in Human Behavior, 27(5), 1820-1822.
This study investigates the educational potential of virtual game worlds, such as World of Warcraft, in enhancing classroom engagement, motivation, and learning outcomes among students.

5. Collaborative Projects:
   a. Dillenbourg, P., & Parés, R. (2004). Analysing the impact of a diaspora project on the development of a virtual community of learners. British Journal of Educational Technology, 35(5), 516-531.
This research examines the impact of collaborative projects, such as Google Docs, on promoting teamwork, communication, and knowledge sharing among students and professionals.

6. Content Communities:
   a. Adner, R. (2006). The market as a platform: How (not) to think about business and management. In Proceedings of the 1st International Conference on Platforms, 1-10.
This paper discusses the concept of content communities, such as Reddit and Stack Overflow, as platforms for creating and sharing knowledge and value among users. It explores the implications for business strategy and management.

These six entries provide a comprehensive overview of various social media technologies, their impacts on different aspects of human interaction, and their potential applications in various fields. They are written in APA citation style to facilitate easy referencing and integration into academic works.
